Controller Methods (Making requests)

Tutti.works Resources

class tutti_client.controller.ResourceController(duct)[source]

Controller methods to make requests relevant to Tutti.works’ essential resources.

An instance of this class is bound to TuttiClient object, which can be accessed from TuttiClient.resource. For instance, methods can be executed in the format of TuttiClient.resource.<method_name>(<args>). See Communication with Server for further details.

async check_project_diff(project_name: str, called=True)[source]

Checks whether a whole project has difference from the last build version.

Parameters

project_name (str) – Project name.

async create_nanotask_group(name: str, nanotask_ids: list, project_name: str, template_name: str, called=True)[source]

Creates a nanotask group for nanotasks.

Parameters

  • nanotask_ids (list) – A list of internal nanotask IDs.

  • project_name (str) – Project name.

  • template_name (str) – Template name.

async create_nanotasks(project_name: str, template_name: str, nanotasks: list, tag: Optional[str] = None, priority: Optional[int] = None, num_assignable: Optional[int] = True, called=True)[source]

Creates one or more nanotasks.

Parameters

  • project_name (str) – Project name.

  • template_name (str) – Template name.

  • nanotasks (list) – Nanotask data, represented by a list of dict objects. As keys, each element must include: props (dict); and can have id (int), tag (str), priority (int), num_assignable (int), and reference_answers (dict).

  • tag (str, optional) – An arbitrary string field for tracking purposes; default value for nanotasks with no specified tag field.

  • priority (int, optional) – A value used for nanotask assignment priority – 1 is the most important; default value for nanotasks with no specified priority field.

  • num_assignable (int, optional) – A maximum number of responses that can be collected for the nanotask; default value for nanotasks with no specified num_assignable field.

async create_project(project_name: str, called=True)[source]
async create_template(project_name: str, template_name: str, preset_group_name: str, preset_name: str, called=True)[source]

Creates a template for project.

A list of available preset_group_name and preset_name can be found by calling list_template_presets.

async get_project_scheme(project_name: str, cached: bool = True, called=True)[source]

Requests a project scheme.

Parameters

  • project_name (str) – Project name.

  • cached (bool) – If True, scheme is loaded and returned from Tutti.works server memory without reflecting any changes made in the project’s scheme.py.

Requests a list of available internal user IDs.

async list_nanotasks_with_responses(project_name: str, template_name: str, called=True)[source]

Requests a list of nanotask IDs associated to a template that collected at least one response record.

Parameters

  • project_name (str) – Project name.

  • template_name (str) – Template name.

async list_template_presets(project_name: str, called=True)[source]

Requests a list of all available template presets.

Note that the returned list is for the deployed version of Tutti.works server – if a project specified in the argument was created in the older server version, some presets in the list is not available.

Parameters

project_name (str) – Project name.

async list_templates(project_name: str, called=True)[source]
async list_templates_with_responses(project_name: str, called=True)[source]

Requests a list of template names in a project that collected at least one response record.

Parameters

project_name (str) – Project name.

async rebuild_project(project_name: str, called=True)[source]

Parameters

project_name (str) – Project name.

async sign_in(user_name: Optional[str] = None, password_hash: Optional[str] = None, access_token: Optional[str] = None, called=True, **kwargs)[source]

Signs into Tutti.works server.

This must be called before calling any other controller methods. A pair of user_name and password_hash, OR valid access_token must be specified as arguments.

Parameters

  • user_name (str, optional) – User name.

  • password_hash (str, optional) – MD5-hashed password.

  • access_token (str, optional) – Access token hash.

async sign_out(called=True)[source]
async sign_up(user_name: str, password_hash: Optional[str] = None, privilege_ids: list = [], called=True, **kwargs)[source]

Signs up for a new user account.

Parameters

  • user_name (str) – User name.

  • password_hash (str, optional) – MD5-hashed password.

Amazon MTurk Resources

class tutti_client.controller.MTurkController(duct)[source]

Controller methods to make requests relevant to Amazon MTurk operations.

An instance of this class is bound to TuttiClient object, which can be accessed from TuttiClient.mturk. For instance, methods can be executed in the format of TuttiClient.mturk.<method_name>(<args>). See Communication with Server for further details.
